Master thesis project

Vein Access control

About the project

The project is my master's thesis entitled "Access control based on handheld biometrics". The project consisted in the development of a device that would enable access control based on the topology of the blood vessel network in the hand. In the project, I designed and built the hardware and housing. The program consists of filtering the input images using a neural network to recognize if the palm of the hand is in the image. The next element is the segmentation and enhancement of the blood vessel image, which is finally compared with a model image stored in a database.

3D hardware model

Assembled 3D models of designed hardware with Raspberry pi

Photo of the constructed device

Picture of the actual device with housing and distance sensors

Neural network training plot

A graph of neural network training designed on the basis of LeNet-5 architecture. The network was used as a filter to detect a hand in a photo.

Segmentation of area with the most veins

To segment the area I used the watershed segmentation algorithm. The rest of the image is cut out.

Enhancement of the image of the blood vessel network

Pre-enhanced vascular image using Contrast Limited Adaptive Histogram Equalization algorithm(CLAHE)

Comparison of two pictures of the same hand with each other

Comparison of two images of blood vessels of the same person. In order to compare them, I used an algorithm for detecting features in the image (ORB), which are then compared with each other using the algorithm of the nearest neighbour.

By Mateusz Janus
